bibl.title: Dziennik Zjednoczenia
YOUR OWN CANDIDATE, BENJAMIN S. ADAMOWSKI

body.p: Primary day is tomorrow! All citizens, interested in the civic government, will go to the polls tomorrow to cast their votes for the various candidates for the different offices. THis will be the first chance to size up the people's will to elect clean and honest candidates to run for offices in the election.
Chicagoans have been notes for their comparative lack of interest in primaries. This is their chance to upset this fact, by stepping out as forcefully as possible.

If there are any unfit candidates running for offices, out with them. Voters of both parties, take good care not to nominate candidates for offices who will not uphold the ideals of your party. Polish voters are looked forward to as people who will support their candidates in the elections. There are
numerous men of Polish descent and real Poles who deserve to receive the candidacy for offices. Those are the men for whom you should vote.

All communities and localities where the Polish vote predominates should unite in force to help their candidates. It is not a shame to remain loyal to proper representatives of the Poles. It is an honor becoming to such a great body of Polish voters as we have in Chicago, that should not be passed by. For once let the Poles show the force and power of their vote.

Voters of the twenty-fifth senatorial district have a Polish candidate for State representative who deserves each and every Polish vote of that particular district. He is none other than Benjamin S. Adamowski, a young attorney who is endorsed by the County Central Committee of the Democratic Party, by the Labor Voters' League, and also by many business and citizens' organizations in the entire twenty-fifth senatorial district. Vote tomorrow for Benjamin S. Adamowski for State representative, and for all the other Polish candidates.
